div.head: THE EGYPTIAN GAZETTE
No. 7,666] ALEXANDRIA, MONDAY, JANUARY 21, 1907. [EIGHT PAGES P.T. 1.
The Eastern Telegraph Company, Limited.
div.p:
This Company's system of submarine telegraph
cables is the most direct and quickest means of
communication from Egypt to Europe, North and
South America, East, South and West Africa,
India, Australia, New Zealand, China and Japan.

To secure quick transmission, telegrams should
be marked Via Eastern.

For latest average time to London, see daily
bulletin in this paper.

STATIONS IN EGYPT: Alexandria, Cairo,
Suez, Port-Tewfik, Port-Saïd, Suakin. Head
Office. London.

div.head: Throw Steel Nibs Away!
div.p: They waste time, are costly to use, wear out, scratch, etc.
Try a "Swan" Fountain Pen.
Prices from 10/6
Sold by all Stationers and Importers in Cairo and Alexandria.
Catalogue free.
Mable, Todd & Bard, High Holborn, London.

div.head: Orient-Royal Mail Line.
div.p: OUTWARD to AUSTRALIA.
R.M.S. “Orotava" will leave Suez about January 25
R.M.S "Ophir" will leave Suez about February 8.
HOMEWARD to NAPLES, MARSEILLES, GIBRALTAR, PLYMOUTH, LONDON, TILBURY.
R.M.S. "Ortona" will leave Port Said February 12
R.M.S. “Oroya" will leave Port Said January 18
Passengers returning by the Line obtain one-third rebate off the above fares if leaving England before the end of October.
Agents. Cairo:—Thos. Cook & Son. Alexandria : —R. J. Moss & Co.—For all particulars apply
Wm. STAPLEDON & Sons, PORT SAID and PORT-TEWFIK (Suez). 31-12-906

div.head: BIBBY LINE MAIL TWIN-SCREW STEAMERS.
div.p: OUTWARDS to COLOMBO, TUTICORIN, etc., and RANGOON.
S.S. Staffordshire 5,785 tons, will leave Suez about January 31, 1907.
HOMEWARDS to MARSEILLES and LONDON.
S.S. Worchestershire 7,160 tons, will leave Port Said about Jan. 26th.
Fares from Port Said to Marseilles £12.0.0 ; London £17.0.0 ; Colombo £32.10.0 ; Rangood £37.10.0
Fitted with Refigerators, Electric Light, Electric Fans and all recent improvements.
SPECIAL REDUCED FARES DURING THE SUMMER SEASON. 12-931
Agents in Cairo: THOS. COOK & SON. For all particulars apply to Suez & Port Said : WM. STAPLEDON & SONS PORT SAID PORT TEWFIK (Suez).

div.head: Deutsche Levante-Linie.
div.p: Mail and Passenger Steamships. Regular Service fortnightly from HAMBURG weekly from ANTWERP; every 4 weeks from Bordeaux direct to Alexandria; homewards every 2 weeks from Alexandria for Rotterdam and Hamburg. Goods forwarded at through-ates from all German Railway Stations on direct Billa of Lading to Alexandria, Cairo, Syria, etc. Special facilities for conveyance of cotton, etc from Alexandria via Rotterdam and Hamburg to German manufacturing towns.
Steamers AT ALEXANDRIA.
S.S. Lys now in port discharging will sail for Piraeus
S.S. Tinos for Rotterdam & Hamburg on or about the 29.
Expect. Jan. 24 SS. Paros from Antwerp.-Jan. 30 S.S. Enos-trom, Hamburg.
For tariff and particulars apply to ADOLPHE STROSS, Alexandria, Agent.

div.head: KHEDIVIAL MAIL LINE.
div.p: Express Steamers leave Alexandria every Wednesday at 4 p.m. for PIRAEUS, SMYRNA, MITYLENE, and CONSTANTINOPLE, in connection with Orient Express train-de-luxe for Vienna, Paris, and London.

Fast steamers leave Alexandria every Saturday at 6 p.m., and Port Said every Sunday at 6 p.m., for JAFFA (for Jerusalem), CAIFFA (for Nazareth), BEYROUT (for Damascus), TRIPOLI, ALEXANDRETTA, MESSINA, continuing in alternate weeks to LARNACA and LIMASSOL (Cyprus).

Steamers leave Suez fortnightly on Wednesday at 6 p.m. for Port Sudan and Snakin direct returning from Suakin every Wednesday noon. Every Monday at 6 p.m. a steamer leaves Suez for Jeddah continuing every other week to Suakin, Massowah, Hedeirab. Aden. Intermediate steamers do not proceed beyond Jeddah at call at Tor, (for Sinai) El Wedj and Yambo as required.
N.B.—Deck chairs provided for the use of passengers, excellent cuisine and table wine free.
Steamer plans may be seen and passages booked at the Company’s Agencies at Alexandria, Cairo, Port Said, and Suez, or at THOS. COOK & SON or other Tourist Agency.

div.head: The Moss S.S. Company, Ltd.
div.p: For LIVERPOOL calling at MALTA (Messrs. JAMES MOSS & Co. 31, James St, Liverpool, Managers.)

*Second class accommodation only, unless specially reserved.—Fares : Alexandria to Liverpool, 1st, £14 Single, £25 Return. 2nd, £9 Single, £15 Return.—To Malta, 1st, £5 Single, £9 Return, 2nd, £3 Single, £5 Return.—Return tickets available for six months.
S.S. Seti now on the berth, will sail on or about Tuesday, 19th January, to be followed by S.S. Menepthah.
Through freight rates on cotton, etc., to Lancashire inland towns, Boston, New York and other U.S.A. towns, obtained on application. Cargo taken by special agreement only.
Passenger Tickets also issued inclusive of Railway fare through to and from Cairo. Particulars on application to
R. J. MOSS & Co., Alexandria, Agents.

div.head: P. HENDERSON & CO’s LINE.
div.p: The Steamers of this Line leave Suez and Port Said every fortnight for London or Liverpool direct.
(Electric Light.) SALOON (Amidships) FARE £12. (Latest improvements.)
S.S. Pegu 5800 Tons will leave PORT SAID about 31st January for Dover. or Hamburg
S.S. Amarapooka 6600 ,, ,, ,, Alexandria … … … … … for Liverpool.
S.S. Arracan 6000 ,, ,, ,, … … … … for Liverpool.
Due in LONDON or LIVERPOOL 13 days.
The Saloon accomodation is amidships, and the vessels are fitted throughout with Electric Light, and have all the latest improvements.
For Further information apply to the Company's Agents.
WORMS & Co., Port Said and Suez. THOS. COOK & SON, (EGYPT) LD., CAIRO ;
G. J. GRACE & CO., ALEXANDRIA.

div.head: Asia Minor Steamship Co., Ltd.
div.p: Regular weekly sailings to Cyprus and Coast of Syria. Steamer leaves Alexandria every alternate Monday afternoon for Limassol, Larnaca, Femagusta, viâ Port Said. First Class Single Fare, Alex. or P. Said to Cyprus £2
Sailings liable to alteration owing to Quarantine, etc.
For further particulars apply: Manager, 3 St. Mark's-Street, Alexandria. 28478-31-12-06

div.head: WHITE STAR LINE.
div.p: NEW YORK AND BOSTON MEDITERRANEAN SERVICE.

Regular Sailings between Alexandria , Naples, and Boston or New York, U.S.A. By the large modern twin screw steamers Cedric, 21,035 tons- Celtic, 21,000 tons- Republic, 14,400 tons- Canopic, 13,000 tons.

Regular Service between Italy and United States throughout the year. Excellent accommodation for all classes of passengers. For plans of steamers, rates of passengers between the various ports, and full particulars, apply to THOS, COOK & SON (Egypt) Ltd., Cairo, Alexandria, Luxor and Assouan; John Ross & Co., Alexandria; White Star Line, Via Roma, Gena, and 21, Piazza della Borsa, Naples.

div.head: Austrian Lloyd’s Steam Navigation
div.p: Alexandria-Brindisi-Venice Trieste. Express Mail Service. Steamers leave Alexandria Saturdays 4 p.m. arrive at Brindisi Tuesdays 5 a.m. in time for Express to Milan, Lucerne, Paris, Vienna, Berlin, London, leaving Brindisi 7 a.m. Arrival at Trieste Wednesdays about 11 a.m. connecting with the Train de Luxe, Trieste-Vienna Ostende. Passengers reach London Fridays 4:50 p.m.
Steamer leaves Alexandria every Thursday 10 a.m.
Syrian-Cyprus-Caramanian Line. Steamer leaves Alexandria about 7, 15, 21, 29 January (4 p.m.)
Far East Lines. Departures from Port Said: To Suez, Aden, Bombay, Colombo, Penang, Singapore, Hong-Kong, Shanghai, Yokohama and Kobé, 3 Feb., 6 March, 3 April, 4 May.
To Suez, Aden and Bombay accelerated service 7, 22 Jan.; 7, 22 Feb. ; 7, 23 March ; 8, 23 April ; 8 May.
To Suez, Aden, Karachi, Colombo, Madras, Rangoon, and Calcutta about 18 Jan., 18 Feb., 18 March, 18 April, 18 May. – For information apply to the Agents, Alexandria, Port Said, Suez, and Khartum.
Special rates for Egyptian officials, members of Army of Occupation and their families.

div.head: NEW KHEDIVIAL HOTEL, ALEXANDRIA.
div.p: First-class Hotel. Situated in Rosetta Avenue, the finest quarter in the Town. Renovated Throughout Two minutes from Railway Station. Close to Consulates and Opera House. Electric Lift. Perfect Sanitary Arrangements. Magnificent Ball, Reception, Reading, and Music Rooms. Bar and Smoking Room.
FINE TERRACE ON THE AVENUE. MOTOR BUS MEETS ALL TRAINS AND STEAMERS. MANAGER F REINSPERCER. 31-8-907

div.head: Egyptian State Railways.
div.p: †Dining Car. §Sleeping Car. ‡First and Second Class only.
On and from Thursday, January 10th, these trains consisting of dining and sleeping cars only will run daily, instead two times a week as heretofore.
G.R. MACAULEY. General Manager
